org.kiji.rest.representations
Class SchemaOption

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.rest.representations.SchemaOption

public class SchemaOption
extends Object

Class that holds two (mutually exclusive) representations of an Avro schema. This can either hold the JSON string representation of the schema (that gets parsed by the Schema.Parser class) or the unique identifier that Kiji assigns to new Avro schemas.

Constructor Summary

          Construct a new SchemaOption specifying the schema UID.
SchemaOption(String schemaString)
          Construct a new SchemaOption specifying the schema as the JSON string.

Method Detail

resolve

public org.apache.avro.Schema resolve(org.kiji.schema.KijiSchemaTable schemaTable)
                               throws IOException
Produce an Avro schema object depending on what was set (string or UID).

Parameters:
schemaTable - is the schema table to use to fetch the Avro schema given a UID
Returns:
the corresponding Avro schema.
Throws:
IOException - if there is a problem fetching the schema from the schema table if the UID is set.

getOptionValue

public Object getOptionValue()
Returns either the UID or the schema string representation. If the UID is -1 then it will try and return the JSON representation of the Avro Schema. If neither work, then returns null. The UID is instance specific and is only used to avoid resultset bloating since the JSON representation of an Avro schema could be large and sending that for each cell can be large.

Returns:
whatever representation of the schema is set (long UID, schema string or null if the UID doesn't resolve to a proper schema object).
